title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Brownies

steps.headline: Prepare the brownie batter.
steps.description: In a saucepan, melt the chocolate and butter over a medium heat. Pour the chocolate butter mixture in a mixing bowl and add the eggs, vanilla, and sugar. Whisk the mixture until smooth. Fold in the flour and place it on the side.

steps.headline: Get a separate bowl for the cookie dough.
steps.description: Whisk the butter, sugar, and brown sugar. Combine the eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, and baking soda & mix thoroughly. Pour in the chocolate chips and gently fold it in.

steps.headline: Use cooking spray on a 9 x 13 baking dish.
steps.description: Scoop a generous amount of cookie dough with a spoon and drop it in even places.

steps.headline: Cover the cookie dough with the brownie batter.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to even the batter out.

steps.headline: Make the chocolate ganache.
steps.description: Add and melt the heavy cream and butter in a small pot. Add the chocolate to the mixture and use a wire whisk to mix until smooth. Carefully pour the ganache over the brownies and use a rubber spatula to even it out. Allow to cool and set aside for about 10-15 minutes.

text: Pre-heat the oven to 350ºF or 180ºC.  Prepare the brownie batter. In a saucepan, melt the chocolate and butter over a medium heat. Pour the chocolate butter mixture in a mixing bowl and add the eggs, vanilla, and sugar. Whisk the mixture until smooth. Fold in the flour and place it on the side. Get a separate bowl for the cookie dough. Whisk the butter, sugar, and brown sugar. Combine the eggs, vanilla, flour, salt, and baking soda & mix thoroughly. Pour in the chocolate chips and gently fold it in. Use cooking spray on a 9 x 13 baking dish. Scoop a generous amount of cookie dough with a spoon and drop it in even places. Cover the cookie dough with the brownie batter. Use a rubber spatula to even the batter out. Bake for about 35 to 40 minutes. Allow to cool. Make the chocolate ganache. Add and melt the heavy cream and butter in a small pot. Add the chocolate to the mixture and use a wire whisk to mix until smooth. Carefully pour the ganache over the brownies and use a rubber spatula to even it out. Allow to cool and set aside for about 10-15 minutes.
